question: Two lines are perpendicular. What is the measure of each angle at their intersection?
Line AB is perpendicular to line CD at point O. What is the measure of ∠AOC if point A, O, C are collinear?
If line l is perpendicular to line m, and ∠1 is the angle between them, what is ∠2 adjacent to ∠1?
Two perpendicular lines form four angles. What is the sum of any two adjacent angles?
If AB ⟂ CD, and ∠BOC is a right angle, what is ∠AOB?
A line is drawn perpendicular to a horizontal line. What is the angle between them?
Two roads cross at right angles. What type of angle do they form?
If lines AB and CD are perpendicular, and ∠AOD is 90°, what is ∠BOD?
Two perpendicular lines intersect. What is the measure of the angle opposite a right angle?
If line XY ⟂ line YZ at Y, what is ∠XYZ?
Two lines intersect at a point and form angles of 50° and x. If they are perpendicular, what is x?
Lines AB and EF intersect at G. If AB ⟂ EF, what is ∠AGF if A, G, F are collinear?
Two perpendicular lines form a straight line across them. What is the angle between the straight line and one of the perpendicular arms?
If line l ⟂ line m at point P, what is ∠QPR where Q, P, R are points on l and m respectively?
Two intersecting lines form four angles. If one is 90°, what are the other three angles?
Two lines intersect at point O forming angles 70° and 110°. Are the lines perpendicular?
Two lines are perpendicular. What is the relationship between any adjacent angle and the opposite ‘vertical’ angle?
Two lines cross. One angle is 130°. What is the vertical angle opposite to it?
Two intersecting lines form angles of 40° and x. What is x if the lines form supplementary pairs?
If two lines intersect and ∠1 = 120°, what is the angle adjacent to ∠1 on the straight line?
Two lines intersect at point P creating angles of 70° and 110°. What is the angle vertical to 70°?
When two lines intersect, what is the sum of two adjacent angles on a straight line?
When two lines intersect, the vertical angles are ________.
If two lines intersect forming an angle of 80°, what is the opposite angle?
Two lines intersect at point O, forming angles A and B that are vertical angles. If ∠A = 55°, what is ∠B?
If two lines intersect and one angle is 100°, what is the other angle on the straight line?
Two lines intersect forming four angles. If one is 45°, what is the angle adjacent to it?
Lines l and m intersect. If one acute angle is 35°, what is its vertical angle?
Lines l and m intersect. If one obtuse angle is 140°, what is the adjacent angle on the straight line?
Lines l and m intersect at 60° in one region. What is the angle directly opposite?
Lines l and m intersect. One angle measures 75°. What is the other three angles combined?
Parallel lines l and m are cut by transversal t. If a corresponding angle is 65°, what is the corresponding angle on the other parallel line?
Parallel lines l and m are cut by transversal t. If an alternate interior angle is 80°, what is its pair on the other side of the transversal?
Parallel lines a and b are cut by transversal c. If an exterior angle is 50°, what is the interior angle on the same side of the transversal?
If two parallel lines are cut by a transversal and one co-interior angle is 110°, what is the other co-interior angle on the same side?
Parallel lines l and m are cut by transversal t. If a corresponding angle on l is 45°, what is the corresponding angle on m?
Parallel lines p and q are cut by transversal r. If an alternate exterior angle is 75°, what is its matching alternate exterior angle?
Parallel lines x and y are cut by transversal z. If angle 1 is 100° and is co-interior with angle 2 on the same side, what is angle 2?
Parallel lines a and b are cut by transversal c. If angle p on a is 30° and is alternate interior to angle q on b, what is angle q?
Lines l and m are parallel. Transversal t crosses them. If an interior angle on one has measure 55°, what is the adjacent interior angle on the same side?
Lines l and m are parallel. Transversal t crosses them. If angle A is 40° (exterior), what is the corresponding interior angle at the far end on m?
Lines l and m are parallel with transversal t. If angle 1 is 120° (alternate interior to angle 2), what is angle 2?
Parallel lines p and q are cut by transversal r. If angle X on p is 70° and angle Y on q is a co-interior angle, what is angle Y?
Parallel lines a and b are cut by a transversal. If one corresponding angle is 85°, what is its vertically opposite angle on the same intersection?
In parallel lines m and n cut by transversal t, if ∠1 is 50° (inside left), what is ∠2 (alternate interior on right)?
Parallel lines l and m cut by transversal t. If ∠P on l is 65° (exterior), what is the interior corresponding angle on m?
Parallel lines p and q cut by transversal r. If ∠A on p is 110° (co-interior with ∠B on q), what is ∠B?
Parallel lines x and y cut by transversal z. If ∠M on x is 25° (alternate exterior with ∠N on y), what is ∠N?
Parallel lines a and b cut by transversal c. If ∠U on a is 140° (interior), what is ∠V on b co-interior with U?
On parallel lines l and m, a transversal creates ∠Q of 95°. Which angle on the other parallel line is supplementary to Q on the same side?
Parallel lines p and q are cut by a transversal. If ∠R on p is 35° (corresponding to ∠S on q), what is ∠S?
Parallel lines a and b cut by transversal c. If ∠D on a is 47° (exterior), what is the interior alternate angle on b?
Parallel lines x and y cut by z. If ∠1 is 82° (interior), what is the co-interior partner ∠2 on the same side?
Parallel lines l and m cut by t. If ∠A on l is 55° (alternate interior to ∠B on m), what is ∠B?
Parallel lines p and q cut by r. If ∠X on p is 20° (adjacent on the same intersection), what is its vertical angle?
Calculate the perimeter of a rectangle with length 8 cm and width 5 cm.
Find the area of a rectangle with length 12 m and width 7 m.
A square has side length 6 cm. What is its perimeter?
Find the area of a square with side length 9 cm.
Calculate the perimeter of an equilateral triangle with side 10 cm.
Find the area of a triangle with base 8 cm and height 5 cm.
A right-angled triangle has legs 6 m and 8 m. What is its perimeter? (Hint: use Pythagoras.)
Calculate the area of a right-angled triangle with legs 6 m and 8 m.
Find the perimeter of a parallelogram with base 7 cm and side 5 cm.
Calculate the area of a parallelogram with base 10 cm and height 4 cm.
A trapezium has parallel sides 6 m and 10 m, and height 4 m. Find its area.
Find the perimeter of an isosceles trapezium with parallel sides 8 cm and 5 cm, and equal non-parallel sides 4 cm each.
Calculate the area of a rhombus with diagonals 9 cm and 12 cm.
Find the perimeter of a regular pentagon with side length 5 cm.
Calculate the area of a regular hexagon with side length 4 cm. (Use area formula: (3√3/2) × side²; √3 ≈ 1.732.)
A regular octagon has side length 3 cm. What is its perimeter?
Find the area of a regular pentagon with side length 6 cm. (Use area ≈ 1.720 × side².)
Calculate the perimeter of a regular triangle (equilateral) with side 12 cm.
Find the area of an equilateral triangle with side 10 cm. (Use area = (√3/4) × side²; √3 ≈ 1.732.)
A quadrilateral has vertices forming a rectangle 5 cm by 2 cm. How many square centimeters is its area?
Calculate the perimeter of a right-angled triangle with legs 3 cm and 4 cm.
Find the circumference of a circle with radius 7 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a circle with diameter 10 m. (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the circumference of a circle with diameter 12 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circle’s area is 50.24 m². What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14; area = πr².)
Calculate the area of a semicircle with radius 5 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the perimeter of a semicircle with radius 6 cm. (Include the diameter; use π = 3.14.)
A circle has radius 0.5 m. What is its area? (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the circumference of a circle with radius 2.5 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the area of a quarter-circle with radius 4 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circle’s circumference is 31.4 cm. What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a circle whose circumference is 18.84 m. (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the perimeter of a regular hexagon with side length 8 cm.
Calculate the area of a regular hexagon with side 5 cm. (Use formula: (3√3/2) × side²; √3 ≈ 1.732.)
A regular octagon has side length 4 cm. What is its perimeter?
Find the area of a regular octagon with side 3 cm. (Use area ≈ 2 × (1 + √2) × side²; √2 ≈ 1.414.)
Calculate the area of an isosceles trapezium with parallel sides 8 cm and 12 cm and height 5 cm.
Find the perimeter of a trapezium with parallel sides 7 m and 10 m, and non-parallel sides 5 m and 6 m.
Calculate the area of a kite with diagonals 6 cm and 8 cm.
Find the perimeter of a kite with equal sides 5 cm and 7 cm.
A regular decagon has side length 3 cm. What is its perimeter?
Calculate the area of a regular decagon with side 2 cm. (Use area ≈ (5/2) × side² × cot(π/10); cot(π/10) ≈ 3.077.)
Find the circumference of a circle with radius 15 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a circle with radius 8 m. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circle’s diameter is 14 cm. What is its area? (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the circumference of a circle with diameter 20 m. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a quarter-circle with diameter 10 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circular garden has radius 4 m. What is its circumference? (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the area of an annulus (ring) with outer radius 6 cm and inner radius 4 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the perimeter of a regular hexagon inscribed in a circle of radius 5 cm. (Side length ≈ radius.)
Find the area of a sector with central angle 90° in a circle of radius 10 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circle’s circumference is 12.56 m. What is its radius? (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a circle whose circumference is 31.4 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the perimeter of a regular heptagon with side length 7 cm.
Calculate the area of a regular heptagon with side 3 cm. (Use formula: (7/4) × side² × cot(π/7); cot(π/7) ≈ 3.078.)
A circle’s radius is halved. By what factor does its area change?
A circular track has radius 20 m. How far does a person travel in one complete lap? (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a circle that fits exactly inside a square of side 8 cm.
Find the difference in area between a circle of radius 5 cm and a square of side 10 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
A regular polygon has 10 sides of length 6 cm. What is its perimeter?
Calculate the area of a regular decagon with side 4 cm. (Use area ≈ (10/4) × side² × cot(π/10); cot(π/10) ≈ 3.077.)
Find the circumference of a circle whose diameter is 15 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the area of a semicircle with diameter 12 m. (Use π = 3.14.)
A circle’s area is 154 cm². What is its diameter? (Use π = 3.14.)
Find the area of a quarter-circle with radius 7 cm. (Use π = 3.14.)
Calculate the perimeter of a square whose area is 144 m².
Find the area of a rhombus with sides 5 cm and an angle of 60° between them. (Use area = side² × sin(angle); sin60° ≈ 0.866.)
Calculate the perimeter of a regular heptagon with side 4 cm.
Find the area of a trapezium with parallel sides 5 m and 9 m, and height 6 m.
Calculate the perimeter of an isosceles triangle with equal sides 7 cm and base 10 cm.
Find the area of an isosceles triangle with equal sides 5 cm and included angle 60°. (Use area = (1/2) × a² × sinθ; sin60° ≈ 0.866.)
